Title:
Evolution of leaf anatomy and photosynthesis pathways in
Portulacaceae
Keywords:
C3-C4 intermediacy, C4 photosynthesis, Cactineae, leaf
anatomy, Portulaca, Portulacaceae, Portulacineae.
Abstract:
Premise of the study: Portulacaceae is a family of the
Caryophyllales with species that use C4 (NADP-ME and NAD-ME variants)
and C3-C4 photosynthesis. In addition, the family displays different
leaf anatomical configurations. Here we addressed the evolutionary
history of leaf anatomy and photosynthetic pathways in
Portulacaceae.
